properties.address: 521 Hertford Road,, Enfield, London EN3 5UA
properties.description: We offer a warm and friendly place and would love to see you at our drop in cafe open every Monday in term time from 10.30am-12noon. We provide free refreshments, free Wi-Fi, board games to play and a little area for your babies and toddlers to play. We also run 'Grow Baby' during this time which is a service that provides free new and good quality used baby clothing and other small items for any families in need as well as a Foodback referral service. We would love to get to know you and help you make new friends in your local community and hope to see you soon.
properties.title: Drop in Cafe

properties.address: St George'sChurch Hall, Enfield, Enfield EN3 6NR
properties.description: A warm and friendly place to get together, make friends and catch up with old ones. The day includes, breakfast, freshly cooked lunch, exercise, bingo and lots more. Every Friday 10am-2pm.
properties.title: Friday Lunch Club - Enfield

properties.address: Goffs Oak Methodist Church, Hertfordshire EN7 5SS
properties.description: Every Wednesday, our building is open to all from 9.30am to 3.00pm. From 9.30am, free coffee/tea/cold drinks are available at 'Coffee and a Chat'. From midday, a light lunch is offered and then, from 1.00pm until 3.00pm, our Food Pantry offers a range of ambient, chilled and frozen foods. A Communities1st adviser is available on a monthly basis to help with issues and queries on a range of topics. There are no charges for any of the above, and all are welcome.
properties.title: Goffs Oak Methodist Church

properties.address: Grange Park Methodist Church, London, London N21 2EU
properties.description: We are open from 10am till 2pm. Space to chat with others, play games or a place to do your crafts. Hot drinks available. Lunch consisting of soup with a roll, cake, fruit and a hot drink is served at 12 noon a suggested donation of Â£2.50.
properties.title: Grange Park Methodist Church

properties.description: Tuesday Coffee morning and Bric a Brac, Listening Place with a welcome to anybody to talk about their loss or share any worries and concerns.

properties.address: Onestonegrove, Middlesex HA8 8BN
properties.description: A fairly large reception/cafe style space that is open to all. We have seating and heating, free filtered tap water, hot and cold drinks for sale (very reasonably priced), free books, games and puzzles for young people, free wifi, and accessible access and toilets. The space is free to use and everyone is welcome. There is also an open office/remote work space, quiet space, prayer space that is available and free for all to use. We can help with technology support, signposting for support services for local residents and general support and guidance.
properties.title: OneStonegrove

properties.address: 37 Bairstow Close, Borehamwood, WD64TB
properties.description: At this Creative Community Cafe, there are regular activities such as crafting, knitting and felting sessions; providing a great opportunity to meet new friends with similar interests, to chat about your hobbies, and enjoy free refreshments. The venue is accessible with plenty of seating, free water, hot drinks, power points, wi-fi and a fridge for small items (such as a lunch or medicine). Venue Capacity: 40 people standing, 20 seated cabaret style Parking is available in front of the building.
properties.title: Organ Hall

properties.address: Phillimore place, Radlett, WD78NN
properties.description: At this Creative Community Cafe, there are regular activities such as knitting and sewing sessions; providing a great opportunity to meet new friends with similar interests, to chat about your hobbies, and enjoy free refreshments. properties.address: Roe Hill Hall, Hatfield, Hertfordshire AL10 8EY
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 11th February 2025** The Roe Hill Community Hub, launching in February 2025, is a warm and welcoming space where people can come together to socialise, relax, and enjoy a friendly atmosphere. Open every Tuesday and Thursday from 10am to 2pm, the hub offers an inviting environment to meet new people, catch up with friends, and take a break from the day. Enjoy a free tea or coffee, treat yourself to a warming bowl of soup or something sweet from our range of confectionery, and even join in a game or two for some light-hearted fun. Whether youâre looking for good company or just a cosy spot to unwind, Roe Hill Community Hub is here for you!
properties.title: Roe Hill Community Hub

properties.address: St Albans URC _ Homewood, Herts AL1 4BH
properties.description: You are warmly invited to drop-in to our Church CafÃ© held on Thursday afternoons starting November 20th 2024 St Albans United Reformed Church, Homewood Road, AL1 4BH â¢Drop in any time between 12.30 â 15.00 â¢Soup lunch served between 12.30 and 13.30 â¢Tea, coffee, cake & biscuits served between 13.30 â 15:00 â¢Do come and join us - a great opportunity to meet others for lunch, tea and a chat â¢Wi-Fi â âWork from Homeâ opportunity if needed â¢Childrenâs activity corner

properties.address: 69 High Road, Bushey Heath, Hertfordshire WD23 1EE
properties.description: The Church has a large hall and a recently updated coffee lounge. Community activities take place throughout the week. The premises are wheelchair accessible and have a wheelchair-accessible toilet. There is a small car park at the rear of the Church and a public car park on the High Road opposite the Church. On Tuesday lunchtime from 11.30-14.00 we will serve soup and rolls, tea and coffee. As well as offering food, drink and a warm space, we are happy for people to just drop in for a chat. We will work with the local council Community Engagement Officer to advertise the warm space alongside an activity or course, which might attract more people. We plan to start on the 5th November 2024.
properties.title: St Andrew's Methodist Church, Bushey Heath

properties.address: St Peter's Church, Edmonton, London N9 8JP
properties.description: We are accessible to all, on the W8 and 191 bus routes. We offer a warm space, light refreshments, quizzes and social interaction all run by volunteers. We run a Foodbank on Tuesdays from 1pm-1.45pm and a Community Coffee Morning every Friday from 9am-12pm
properties.title: St Peter's Church, Edmonton

properties.address: United Reformed Church, Enfield, EN2 0BS
properties.description: The Sunshine Club is a vibrant community gathering where members come together for a morning of wellness and fun! Each session kicks off with hot drinks and biscuits providing a warm and inviting start to the day. Our activities include a variety of low-impact exercises tailored to suit all fitness levels, promoting both physical health and vitality. After getting energized, members enjoy a delicious light lunch, perfect for recharging and socializing with friends. To round off the day, we offer engaging activities that range from games, bingo or a quiz. Join us every Tuesday for a fun packed morning.
properties.title: The Sunshine Club
